meanings.definition: The action of copying or reproducing something.
meanings.sent1: The artist made several replications of the painting to sell at the art fair.
meanings.sent2: She requested a replication of the document for her records.
meanings.sent3: The machine made so many replications of the key that she couldn't find the original one!
meanings.sent4: His style was a replication of the famous painter, with every brushstroke mimicking the original.
meanings.sent5: The endless replications of the song on the radio made it impossible to escape.

meanings.definition: A duplicate or copy of something.
meanings.sent1: The store offered a discount on replications of famous artworks.
meanings.sent2: He kept a replication of his passport in a safe place while traveling.
meanings.sent3: The replication of the cake turned out to be even tastier than the original!
meanings.sent4: The city was a perfect replication of a miniature model, with every detail meticulously recreated.
meanings.sent5: The replication of the ancient artifact was so precise that experts were fooled at first glance.

meanings.definition: The process of repeating an experiment or study to confirm results.
meanings.sent1: Scientists rely on replications to ensure the accuracy of their findings.
meanings.sent2: The professor emphasized the importance of conducting replications in research.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the teacher announced they would be doing replications of the volcano experiment.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project hinged on the careful replications of the initial study.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous replication of the data revealed a consistent pattern across all trials.
